body_html:
@rober42539 I skimmed your build log. And it seems that the user flag is not properly set. Could you do the following?

set "USER_LDFLAGS=/LIBPATH:[lib path that point to tbb.lib, e.g. %MKLProductDir%\tbb\lib\intel64_win\vc_mt]"
## ensure this one is properly set
echo %USER_LDFLAGS%
body_text:
@rober42539 I skimmed your build log. And it seems that the user flag is not properly set. Could you do the following?
set "USER_LDFLAGS=/LIBPATH:[lib path that point to tbb.lib, e.g. %MKLProductDir%\tbb\lib\intel64_win\vc_mt]"
## ensure this one is properly set
echo %USER_LDFLAGS%
body:
@rober42539 I skimmed your build log. And it seems that the user flag is not properly set. Could you do the following?
```powershell
set "USER_LDFLAGS=/LIBPATH:[lib path that point to tbb.lib, e.g. %MKLProductDir%\tbb\lib\intel64_win\vc_mt]"
## ensure this one is properly set
echo %USER_LDFLAGS%
```
